reviewTitle: Great value, love the simplistic design
reviewDescription: Very simple and functional yet it has all of the essentials without any of the gimmicky frills. Maybe it takes a $300 laptop so I don't have to deal with built in Alexa-enabled something, HP-specific ports, fingerprint scanner, and other stuff I don't want or need. They don't try anything fancy with this one which for me is a positive. Plus it's TKL keyboard which really should be the new norm. Does not have a backlit keyboard which is a slight miss but for the price it's not a huge deal.You can take it out of S-mode easily and remove a lot of the addons and you have yourself a perfectly functional Windows machine. Despite the lower-tier hardware it still starts up very quickly if you make sure you don't have too much bloatware. Sure it's a little slow at times but if you're using it for day to day tasks it should be fine. Battery life seems very good, the laptop is also fairly lightweight as well. What more could you ask for at this price point.

reviewTitle: very nice I just enjoying my lap top is TOP
reviewDescription: I really like very much my lap top I just got it . I am very satisfied  with it. thank you HP

I recently purchased the HP Newest 14" Ultralight Laptop and let me tell you, it has been an absolute game-changer for both my student life and my business needs. As someone who is always on the go, I needed a reliable laptop that could keep up with my busy schedule, and this laptop has exceeded all of my expectations.Let's start with the design - this laptop is sleek, lightweight, and portable, making it perfect for carrying around campus or taking to meetings. The 14" screen is the perfect size for both work and play, and the Intel Quad-Core N4120 processor ensures that everything runs smoothly and quickly. The 8GB of RAM and 192GB of storage (64GB eMMC + 128GB Micro SD) provide more than enough space for all of my files, photos, and videos.One of my favorite features of this laptop is the 1 Year Office 365 subscription that comes included. Having access to all of the Microsoft Office programs has made it so much easier for me to stay organized and productive. The webcam is great for virtual meetings, and the HDMI, WiFi, and USB-A ports make it easy to connect to external devices and accessories.But what truly sets this laptop apart is its incredible value for the price. I was a bit hesitant at first because of how affordable it is, but I can confidently say that this laptop is worth every penny. The performance and quality are on par with laptops that cost twice as much, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.In conclusion, if you're a student or a business professional in need of a reliable, efficient, and affordable laptop, with amazing battery life, look no further than the HP Newest 14" Ultralight Laptop. It's a 5-star product that will truly make your life easier and more enjoyable. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!.
Liked everything. Great price.  Thanks
Definitely worth the cost!

reviewTitle: Works. Nothing fancy. Not supposed to be.  Looks nice.
reviewDescription: Nothing fancy but works for internet surfing and word processing just fine.Make sure you take it out of s mode.Pretty good deal. Came With extra storage card since its got small Storage capacity.Holds a charge. As long as it lasts a coupleYears or so, im happy with it.I needed a basic spare computer.Would recommend. For basic light computer.

reviewTitle: Great Value.  Easy to set up
reviewDescription: Great value for this robust laptop by HP.  I was very impressed with how easy it was to set up.  I am 61 years old and can be challenged by technology.  Surprisingly, I was able to completely set up with all of my accounts in three hours.  The HP laptop was half the price of my old laptop I purchased in 2019.  I am thrilled and highly recommend.

I bought this laptop for my son last year to use at college. He wanted a smaller, lighter laptop than his previous one to make it easier to pack around campus, so this was perfect for his needs. He has reported that the computer was quick and performed well for completion of his research and other assignments. Unfortunately, the laptop sustained damage while moving to a new place (his fault).  Therefore, he needed a new one. He liked this one so much, he decided to order this one again.
I really wanted a touch tone computer but, they're pricey. I don't have much time to use this computer but, it's so far it I'm satisfied.ThsnkU, S

I baught this computer because I dumped a protein shake on my large one and I use it for school. It’s quick and clean and stylish. Small enough to carry in my bag but large enough to do its job. The battery lasts a long time too
The day we received and tried to operate, so frustrated returned it.  Disappointing.  I bought this to have the Webcam and microphone so I ordered a Webcam Monitor.

I just received this computer yesterday, took it out the box, plugged it in, set it up and go to use it, the screen wouldn’t do anything but flash! After spending 40 mins on the phone with HP tech support including 2 video calls so they could see the computer, they wanted me to spend $45 MORE to have a flash drive with a new operating system. HP IS TRASH!!! This is literally the second brand new out of the box HP product that has not worked for me in the past month!!! They wanted $19.99 to help me with my printer. Product Returned!!!

reviewTitle: White boot screen - don't try to call HP warranty
reviewDescription: Bought this laptop for my son. After less than a month he went to school and this is what he was presented with. After going thru the difficulties of HP warranty, they say this must be taken care of by the Amazon seller, not them. So, just make sure you don't think the warranty is covered by HP. Original system (according to HP) was shipped with a 16G hard drive and only 4G of RAM, and that since it was altered that we would need to go back thru the reseller.Depending on their results of their response to this review, I may update.

The laptop seemed ok at first. Turned on and after a few minutes of using it, while watching a YouTube video, the screen went dark. I could still hear the video playing, but the screen remained dark even after touching the keys and touch pad. When I shined a flashlight on the screen I could see that the screen was still on, but dark and tried turning up the brightness at that point. That didn’t work. Had to return.

reviewTitle: Even for class work, runs very slow!
reviewDescription: When it arrived, the attached damage was observed. No damage to the box, though, so it was shipped in this condition. But all ports worked properly, so the damage didn't hinder any of the uses. I use this laptop solely for class work, run minimal tabs and it still runs slowly. Unnecessary applications were uninstalled/disabled, which didn't improve performance. Ontop of that, the time/date always unsyncs and picks up the time/date when it was previously online. So I have to constantly resynce it when it conflicts with a program I have to use. Adjusting the advance settings for it to automatically do this didn't resolve it.With patience, I am able to complete my class work. But I don't recommend the product and advice others to look into other products.

Bought this laptop for the very simplest of reasons (to make books on Shutterfly) and it will not stop with making me restart to update. This is the 4th “update restart” in less than an hour. The computer screen just goes blank for a couple seconds at a time. It’s slow af. I’m about to return it if it doesn’t start to work properly

I bought this computer for the price and office 365. I did not like that it came in S mode, which prohibits you from downloading anything that is not Microsoft store approved like google chrome or our epson printer. The seller said in their description that you can remove it, but it was far from easy. It took several hours of researching, trying and failing, contacting the seller, who gave instructions for removing it from windows 10 when they sold me a computer with windows 11. I replied to them and told them they sent the wrong instructions and never heard back. I would stay clear of this computer, even tho it has a tempting price.

reviewTitle: Garbage - can't even browse on Chrome
reviewDescription: Absolute garbage. I had low expectations for this computer, but I hoped it could at least serve the one purpose I bought it for: to browse the internet. It fails miserably even at that. Having more than like 5 Chrome tabs open, the performance becomes insanely slow and laggy. System says it has 8GB of RAM, so this is shocking. All drivers are up-to-date, and still the thing is garbage. Google Meets is a choppy nightmare, running any kind of extra apps or dual monitor in addition makes the thing unusable.Build quality: very poor. It arrived with the keyboard-side plastic surface slightly bulging from the housing. Trackpad stinks, very loud & "clicky". Screen is really poor quality. HP bloatware is obnoxious - blows my mind you would add even more performance drag on an already budget POS.Really disappointed in this thing for having so many high ratings. Any chrome book are probably a way better choice than this. Frankly better off just spending more money on a better laptop, this thing is bottom of the barrel garbage. Total waste of time & money

reviewTitle: Screen flashing on and off/freezing up
reviewDescription: UPDATE: my son used this laptop no more than 3x for a class and the screen started flashing on and off and freezing up. very disappointed.It was time to upgrade our teen’s Chromebook and we got a great deal for prime day. This runs very smoothly and fast. We are very happy with our purchase so far. Our high school student will be using it for schoolwork.

After having issues with this laptop I discovered, that the hardware in it is “upgraded”, but not with HP hardware. So, even if you have a “warranty” with HP it is not covered. So I would steer clear from this one. I will say Amazon customer service helped make it right in the end. But, I just wanted to let others know.

Bought this to be my gaming/fun laptop. It’s lightweight, but feels insanely cheap. The amount of GB it says this laptop has, it doesn’t have. I went to download something and couldnt because there’s already no space on the laptop. I would say spend more money to get a better laptop. This one is not it.

If you plan on spending a lot of time typing on this computer, you will most likely find it frustrating and here’s why.1. Design. The keyboard is set unnecessarily high. There doesn’t need to be that much space at the bottom of the keyboard. It’s not ergonomically functional. I am a writer and I frequently lose paragraphs at a time because as I’m typing my palm slides over the touch pad and highlights text. I often find myself wondering what happened to a whole block of text. Obviously clicking the undo button in the middle of a writing project could mean clicking undo 75 times before you find the mistake.2. The screen is way too small for a writer because it is long. That means that your document will only display about 4 inches at a time unless you minimize the text down to about 70%. As a writer, these options are very frustrating.3. I believe this laptop was advertised as a touchscreen, it is not.4. Auto sync- don’t do it unless you really want everything transferred over to your brand new laptop. I have old files that should’ve been deleted from my old computer now on my new computer and I never wanted any of that. Be really careful with the options you select if you do end up buying this laptop.What I do like about the computer is that it’s

Love the laptop itself, works great so far for school work, and basic eamiling and web surfing, but trying to type is very difficult. The keys themselves are silver and so is the writing on them. Battery life is terrible, constantly has to be plugged in. Just not what i expected. First laptop i have bought since dell made the inspiron colorful ones. So like 2010.... do not recommend

I just received this today. I claimed and set up the 1 yr free subscription to Microsoft 365 Personal that was included with my offer. I even signed up to continue it at the end of 1 year on my cc on 12/10/24 when the subscription expires. After set up, I got a pop up on the computer from Microsoft  asking me to accept the License Agreement which states that I can use Office until Thursday 11/16/23 - 5 DAYS FROM TODAY!!! - after which most features of Office will be DISABLED (see photo of screen included with my review). I called Asurian (yes I bought the warranty) for tech help and they said the warranty does not cover software and don’t know what the problem is. They ga e me the number to call HP, which I did, but they don’t open until Monday, the day I need to start using this computer. In the meantime, I have a useless computer locked up with a pop up screen unless I want to “accept” these terms. I don’t think so! I’m hoping whoever sells this product package can explain this mess. If so, I can upgrade my review with more stars. If not, I’ll repost with 1 star and recommend 0 stars.

reviewTitle: Keys are “sticky” out of the box
reviewDescription: While trying to set up the laptop a few of the keys have to be pressed really hard for them to register and don’t pop right back up.
Ellos me vendieron  esa lapto disque con un año de Microsoft gratis y no funciona, y lo peor es que no me resuelven con la activacion esto es un fraude al cliente.

reviewTitle: Streaming almost impossible and very slow
reviewDescription: Tabs and computer as a whole freezes a lot. It does what I need it to (sometimes) which is just reading my email and working on school stuff. Apart from that, even online shopping has proven difficult as it freezes a lot and you have to wait before you continue scrolling. Lots of crash reports for different program, but mostly web browsers. In conclusion, you get what you pay for - if you're looking for a laptop to work on documents on, you'll be fine with this one. If you're looking for one for anything else, keep looking.
It’s very slow and has poor resolution. Mine doesn’t charge well at all.  Save your money and buy a better computer.

reviewTitle: TOO MANY PROGRAMS, NOT ENOUGH RAM
reviewDescription: The white Laptop I purchased is nice, sleek, lightweight, and looks modern, but runs like a commodore 64! After spending a couple nights trying to clean, defrag, and modernize its OS speed, I threw in the towel! I bought the comp due to a project I need completed asap. Bc I had a hard deadline, so I couldn't spend days & days increasing its' speed. I would buy it again W/O all the programs, and Yet AMAZON Keeps the laptop laden w numerous programs i

reviewTitle: S mode by microsoft made it useless.
reviewDescription: Comes with S mode that it was impossible to get out of.Only Microsoft apps allowed  made it useless for me.

reviewTitle: For the price it is very good
reviewDescription: This is not a touch screen, for the price it’s hard to get a touch screen.  I use this for work remotely.  It’s starts quickly and has no lag or other junk slowing it down.  I had a dell that was three times the price and awful.  The memory is non existent so I added a large SIM card and external drive for $80, still cheaper than other computers.  I can run excel and a few apps at once but have not tried gaming.  The screen resolution is okay, would be an issue with gaming.  The battery life using just the internet is 6 hours.  It is easy to get out of S Mode to make it easier to download apps.
I’ve just recently started using this laptop. It seems to be working great.
Got this as a graduation gift for my grandson. He’s very happy with it and plans to use it for college.
Todo bien
I bought this computer for my job. I needed a new laptop cuz I work from home every other Friday. This computer has been great. Its fast and lightweight.

For the price point (which is very reasonable), I have no complaints.  Using this laptop as a backup for my work issued computer and quite frankly I prefer using this thing.  I run through a virtual desktop anyway and getting this laptop fired up is a breeze.  Battery life is decent.  No touch screen capability, but that's not a deal killer in my book.  Worth the minimal investment I made.
Setup was a breeze. The only drawback is Microsoft store doesn't have some of the apps I want.
Realmente funciona súper bien, tiene un tamaño perfecto y es súper rápida me encanta

I like the HP brand. It's not overly expensive and serves it's purpose. I've used similar laptops from junior college to the Master's program and will be using this one for business. I would recommend.
It is smaller than I really wanted, but it is very light weight, the battery life is great, and it is so much faster than my previous laptop.  Worth the money for sure.
I love my new laptop! It’s easy to use, user friendly and fits easily into my bag
Easy to hook up to my wifi and set-up.  Loving my new laptop.

Computer is truly excellent for the cost! So happy with it from ease of setup to functionality. My only caveat is you MUST capture and follow the instructions --available twice in the product listing-- for disabling "S Mode" if you want to download anything that's not a Microsoft product. You will be bullied to use Microsoft Edge. Ignore that. Overall, super happy with this purchase!

My Acer died the Black Screen Death in a couple years.  I like it for the basic print things google and Amazon.  I am usually on my Iphone.  Seems well made for under $300.  I am 81 so it serves my purpose.  I do like Windows 11.

After setting everything up for my husband, which took a normal amount time, the laptop is performing well.  Other than checking email, shopping on Amazon and EBay and playing Google Solitare, we don’t ask too much from a laptop. One of the most important features is a secure power connection and this one has a pin connection which seems secure.

My MacBook got too old and like most apple products by the time they come out with the newest model the software updates start to overload the hardware causing the computer to glitch, malfunction, and eventually crash leaving you with no choice but to spend more money on yet another computer. I’ve never had that problem with HP laptops! They have always lasted longer than MacBooks by at least 3 years! Nothing bad to say! One of my favorite makes!
